questions.question: I had my car ___ yesterday.
questions.explanation: We use the past participle with 'have something done'.

questions.question: She will get her hair ___ for the wedding.
He had the documents ___ by a lawyer.
They got their car ___ last week.
I'm going to have my phone ___.
questions.explanation: 'Have + object + past participle' is used in plans too.

questions.question: Did you get your laptop ___?
questions.explanation: Past simple question in causative form.

questions.question: They had their garden ___ by a professional.
questions.explanation: Past perfect causative with 'had + object + past participle'.

questions.question: We will get the air conditioning ___ before summer.
She got her essay ___ by her friend.
He’s getting his suit ___ for the event.
Have you had your phone ___ yet?
They got the pipes ___ after the leak.
questions.explanation: 'Get + object + past participle' to describe work done.

questions.question: I had the photo ___ into a frame.
questions.explanation: 'Put' is the past participle used in causative here.
